results.title: Energy Conservation in the Home
results.creator_credit: Dept of Minerals and Energy AV Workshop
results.brief_description:
“Energy conservation in the home” provides useful information on the ways in which energy can be saved within the household.

See also Related Title 325491 “Victoria’s energy”; uses stills to analyse Victoria’s energy position during 1980-81.

results.title: Seeds of change
results.creator_credit: Diane O'Connor and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Examines changes in Victorian farm life documenting its evolution from horse to tractor to modern machinery. Filmed on location at Jeparit, this program uses period re-creation and documentary footage.

results.title: Autumn days
results.brief_description: Shows without commentary some of the special features of autumn and how people prepare themselves for the cold weather ahead. It covers typical autumn activities, the turning of the leaves, harvesting of apples, and autumn in the country. Suitable for lower primary level.
results.description: Shows without commentary some of the special features of autumn and how people prepare themselves for the cold weather ahead. It covers typical autumn activities, the turning of the leaves, harvesting of apples, and autumn in the country. Suitable for lower primary level.

results.title: Graham Baxter: park ranger
results.creator_credit: Rob Salvatore and ACMI Content Development
results.brief_description: Only a fortunate few live and work in a place as beautiful as this. Wilson’s Promontory Park Ranger Graham Baxter explains why every day for him is a special day in this place ‘for the soul’.

results.title: Old man: returning to Lake Condah Mission

video_links.name: Old man: returning to Lake Condah Mission

results.brief_description: This is a documentary film about growing up on Lake Condah Aboriginal Mission. A local Elder, Uncle Kenny Saunders, visits the site of Lake Condah Mission and talks about his childhood memories revealing a past of cruelty and fear, and the devastation felt in the aftermath of the Eumerella massacres.
results.title_for_label: Old man: returning to Lake Condah Mission

results.title: A Postcard from Ovens
results.creator_credit: ACMI Content Development, Jack Keane and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: An edited excerpt from ‘Working Holiday’ (1957) produced by Jack Keane for the Victorian Department of Agriculture. Shows hop picking in Victoria where seasonal workers gather from all parts of Australia for six weeks to harvest hops in the rich Ovens Valley. The weekend breaks are spent swimming, fishing or sight-seeing in the surrounding Alps.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Content Development, Jack Keane and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.description: An edited excerpt from ‘Working Holiday’ (1957) produced by Jack Keane for the Victorian Department of Agriculture. results.title: Getting the message
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: Dramatization of the difficulties faced by an illiterate adult in employment and social situations. Suggests that with concern and adequate teaching methods this problem can be overcome. The film highlights the plight of the hundreds of illiterate Australian adults.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre

results.title: Curriculum by Technology
results.creator_credit: Brendan Kenworthy, Bendigo Education Resource Centre, TV Ed Productions and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Shows how Bendigo Education Resource Centre is introducing new technology into distance education to increase the range of curriculum subjects offered for Year 11 and 12 students in isolated schoolos in the Mallee area: Telepaks, telephone links, fax machines, Macintosh computers, lessons on VHS tapes. Introduction by Justin Shortal.
